description: System-generated unique identifier for this site record.
Business key for the site used across the application.
Human-readable name of the site or facility.
Tax or federal registration number for the operating entity; confirm with SME.
Code defining how labor costs are calculated at this site (e.g., standard, average); confirm with SME.
Default hourly labor rate used when no specific rate is available.
Default labor grade or classification applied for costing or scheduling; confirm with SME.
Planned working hours available on Mondays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Tuesdays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Wednesdays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Thursdays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Fridays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Saturdays for scheduling capacity.
Planned working hours available on Sundays for scheduling capacity.
Annual sick leave hours reducing labor availability.
Annual vacation hours reducing labor availability.
Other annual non-working hours reducing labor availability.
Daily break time deducted from schedulable hours.
Daily lunch time deducted from schedulable hours.
Other daily non-productive time deducted from schedulable hours.
Expected percentage of on-shift time considered productive for planning.
Default prefix applied to generated work order numbers.
Most recently assigned work order number used for sequencing.
Most recently assigned service request identifier for sequencing.
Most recently used schedule sequence or batch identifier.
Most recently assigned billing or invoice identifier for sequencing.
Timestamp of the last preventive maintenance work order generation run.
Flag to sort work orders by priority from highest to lowest by default.
Selected report template used when printing work orders.
Flag indicating whether comments are included on printed work orders.
Flag requiring a priority value on new work records.
Default priority value applied to new work items; confirm with SME.
Automatically create supplier associations when parts are transacted or added.
Automatically copy task details to new or generated work orders.
Default prefix applied to purchase order numbers.
Most recently assigned purchase order number for sequencing.
Inventory costing method used for parts at this site (e.g., average, last, standard).
Allow inventory balances to drop below zero.
Enable use of sublocations within a warehouse for inventory storage.
Warehouse used by default for inventory transactions and issues.
Enforce that parts must exist in predefined warehouse locations before use.
Automatically link assets to maintenance procedures when applicable.
Enable automatic issue and receipt processing for parts; confirm with SME.
Enable automatic processing for miscellaneous cost issues and receipts; confirm with SME.
Selected report template used when printing purchase orders.
Flag indicating whether comments are included on printed purchase orders.
Default country setting for addresses, taxes, and localization.
Default currency used for transactions and reporting at this site.
Enable transactions in multiple currencies.
Default application menu or navigation layout assigned to users at this site.
Disallow 'contains' search filter in lookups to improve performance or data rules.
Characters not allowed in key data fields to enforce data hygiene.
Disable purchasing functions for this site.
Require general ledger coding on purchasing transactions.
Require general ledger coding on applicable transactions across modules.
Default general ledger account used when no specific account is provided.
Date when the last accounting or inventory period close was completed.
Host name of the file server storing document attachments.
File system path where attachments are stored.
File system path monitored for inbound mail or request imports.
Default file system path for generated reports.
Rule controlling schedule lockouts to prevent overbooking or conflicts.
Custom label for the first tax field used on purchasing documents.
Custom label for the second tax field used on purchasing documents.
Custom label for the third tax field used on purchasing documents.
Default rate for the first tax applied to purchases.
Default rate for the second tax applied to purchases.
Default rate for the third tax applied to purchases.
Setting controlling whether order date determines cost application; confirm with SME.
Include component quantities on printed documents or reports.
Domain host or IP used for email or integration services.
SMTP server used for sending system emails.
Username used for connecting to the mail or integration server.
Password used for connecting to the mail or integration server.
Proxy server used for outbound network connections.
Automatically update maintenance schedules when related data changes.
Timestamp when this record was last updated.
Free-form notes relevant to this site’s configuration or usage.
Selected barcode font or style used for labels and reports.
Default general ledger code applied to purchase order line items.
Rule defining when purchase documents are created in the process flow.
Enable calculation/printing of barcode check digits.
Timestamp of the most recent data import for this site.
Timestamp of the most recent data export for this site.
Designated administrative account or role overseeing the system.
Maximum allowed failed login attempts before user lockout.
Site setting for date/time source or format (e.g., server vs. local); confirm with SME.
Audit field indicating the user-related last modification; overlaps with other audit fields; confirm with SME.
Copy user-defined fields from part records to purchase orders.
Copy user-defined fields from purchase orders to receipts.
Default general ledger account used for work order postings.
Fiscal year configuration (e.g., start month or code); confirm with SME.
Report template used when printing released purchase orders.
Report template used when printing purchase requests.
Report template used when printing blanket purchase orders.
Default to create a printable version when generating work orders.
Default handling or processing cost applied per purchase order.
Global option controlling how defaults are selected across forms; confirm with SME.
Display linked work orders directly from service requests.
Enable autocomplete behavior in lookup fields.
Enforce strong password policy settings.
Minimum required password length.
Maximum allowed password length.
Requirement for uppercase characters in passwords.
Requirement for lowercase characters in passwords.
Requirement for numeric characters in passwords.
Restriction preventing reuse of recent passwords.
Number of days before passwords must be changed.
Explanation of which characters are disallowed and why.
Control for when proof-of-purchase indicators are cleared; confirm with SME.
Most recently assigned attachment identifier for sequencing.
Label report template used for items received on purchase orders.
Label report template used for inventory receipt/adjustment transactions; confirm with SME.
Report template for generating physical inventory count lists.
Force all users to log off for maintenance or updates.
Block entry of dates in the future on work-related transactions.
Automatically flag newly added suppliers for review or follow-up.
Enable password reset functionality for users.
Allow issuing purchase orders without a prior work order estimate.
User who created this record.
Timestamp when this record was created.
User who last modified this record.
Timestamp when this record was last modified by a user.
Default requirement for commitments/encumbrances before purchasing.
Retention period for code and transaction history; confirm with SME.
